channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Intel shares fall after Trump demands the CEO ‘resign, immediately’
item.description: Trump said Intel Chief Executive Lip-Bu Tan “is highly CONFLICTED."

item.title: Stunning new data reveals 140% layoff spike in July, with almost half connected to AI and ‘technological updates’
item.description: The summer of layoffs is real, according to the July monthly "job cut" report from employment consultancy Challenger, Gray & Christmas.

item.title: Want to attend the Master’s with a private chef and stay in a luxury home? It’ll cost you $219,000
item.description: It's the third year the tournament has offered a high-end package.

item.title: Palantir CEO says working at his $430 billion software company is better than a degree from Harvard or Yale: ‘No one cares about the other stuff’
item.description: Sorry, Apple, Google, and OpenAI, Palantir’s billionaire boss Alex Karp says a job at his AI firm is the ‘best credential in tech.’

item.title: Toyota sounds its loudest warning bell yet about tariffs with an expected $9.5 billion profit hit
Dow wobbles after triple-digit run-up at opening bell — live updates
Unemployment-claims data show no sign of rise in layoffs
Trump calls on Intel’s CEO to resign
Bank of England committee was so divided there were two interest-rate votes
Economic calendar: Jobless-claims and wholesale-inventories data upcoming
